description: From Middle English brustlien and brastlien, related to German prasseln (“to crackle”). See burst.

verbs.description: brustle (third-person singular simple present brustles, present participle brustling, simple past and past participle brustled)

entries.meaning: To make a show of fierceness or defiance; to bristle.
examples: Cour. Oh, an Atheist, Sir; he believes neither God nor the Devil. Fath. 'Sbud, I'll brustle up to him. Are you an Atheist, Fellow? hoh?
